Day 20: such a NICE practice.

Took a couple of days off for a three-day migraine, but this was a good way to get back into it. It always feels a little weird, if I miss a day or two right before a 'soft' practice like this one, because oh, why couldn't I have just done it a couple of days ago, why do I need a restful practice if I just rested for three days--but that's not necessarily the point. Even if I've spent a couple of days being quiet, the moment to just BE PRESENT is worth so much.

This month (last month, the rest of this month, however long it takes me to get through this sequence, whatever I come to next) is a journey, but I'm always reminding myself that a journey doesn't need to just be about its destination. Am I getting better at yoga? Yes. Is just doing the thing worthwhile, whether I learn or not, whether my knowledge or practice is changed or not, just for the sake of doing it? YES. I become a little more, learn a little more, change a little more, every time I do this, but it doesn't have to be about who I am becoming. Sometimes it's just about who I am being.

I wanted to share this because normally I would think "it's a 30 day yoga challenge I have to do it everyday!" and I would either beat myself up for missing a day or try to play catch up, making mental arrangements thinking "alright so the one I missed was 25 mins, maybe I can add that onto day x?". Somehow I would think that if I don't do it perfectly that would take away from the worth of the challenge and in today's pause I realized I had let go of that notion.

So this is for anyone out there who shares similar unhelpful perfectionist tendencies (myself included): remember you are doing this for yourself. Whatever shape or form you choose to take part in this is valid. You are allowed to modify it in a way that fits you, whether that is skipping a day or even two, following a more extended schedule or taking heavy modifications during practice, it is all okay. Well done for keeping at it in a way that serves you <3
